title: Elevating the Ordinary
sub_head: In Yasujiro Ozu’s ‘Tokyo Story,’ a quiet domestic drama pushes us to reflect on our own lives.
body:
In the opening scene of Yasujiro Ozu’s “Tokyo Story,” Shukichi and Tomi Hirayama are packing for a train ride to Japan’s capital from their home in provincial Onomichi.
“This is our chance to see all our children,” Shukichi, the husband and father, remarks to a neighbor.
“They must be looking forward to your arrival,” she replies.
